Name: Stela of Isaac
Description: This stela of the 7th-8th centuries is composed of three registers. The lunette shows a triangular frontispiece with geometric motives, surrounded by plants. In the middle of the second register, a bird (an eagle?) with a "necklace" spreads out its wings and turns its head to the right. At the bottom, a roman type "sign", provided with two crosses, contains a text written in Greek.
